title: Microsoft Visio 2000 working
description:
I haven't found this anywhere, so i post it here because it's my favourite torrent site. it's virus free, a personal copy.
Greetings from Croatia!

________________________________________________________________________

NOTE For information on installing and running Visio 2000, Standard Edition, on networks, please see the NETWORK.WRI file at the root of the Visio 2000 CD.


OPERATING SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS FOR VISIO 2000

To use Visio 2000, Standard Edition, you must be running one of the following 32-bit Microsoft Windows operating systems:
Microsoft Windows 95
Microsoft Windows 98
Microsoft Windows NT 4.0 (Service Pack 3 or later is required)
Microsoft Windows 2000

Service Packs for Windows 95, Windows 98, and Windows NT operating systems can be obtained from Microsoft Corporation (www.microsoft.com). 

NOTE To install Visio 2000 on a workstation running Windows NT 4.0, the user installing the product must have Administrator privileges for that workstation.


OTHER SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS

PC with a Pentium 166 MHz or or higher processor
Microsoft Windows 95 or later operating system, or Microsoft Windows NT Workstation or Windows NT Server version 4.0 with Service Pack 3, or later operating system
For Windows 95 or Windows 98: 16 MB of RAM for the operating system, plus 16 MB of RAM for Visio 2000, Standard Edition
For Windows NT Workstation or Windows NT Server version 4.0: 32 MB of RAM for the operating system, plus 16 MB of RAM for Visio 2000, Standard Edition
80 MB of free disk space (typical installation)
CD-ROM drive (for installation only)


THE VISIO 2000 INSTALLATION PROCESS

Visio 2000 products incorporate the latest installation technology from Microsoft. This technology gives you more control over the Visio features you install and updates your computer with only the most recent Microsoft system files that Visio 2000 requires.

The Visio 2000 Setup program occurs in two major parts:
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢	A system update, which may require installation of Microsoft system files and, in some cases, Microsoft Internet Explorer 5.0 (see below).
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢	Installation of the Visio 2000 program.

The information in this section describes what happens during each part of the Visio 2000 installation.

NOTE  Installation Path Length Limitation:  To ensure operation of the Visio 2000 solutions, the folder in which you chose to install Visio 2000, Standard Edition must have a path name shorter than 55 characters in length.

Updating your system
Before Setup installs Visio 2000, it runs the system update program "Mssup.exe" to check for up-to-date system files that the Visio program requires and replaces those that are outdated. These files enable Visio 2000 to support Microsoft technologies such as Open Database Connectivity (ODBC), Visual Ba product.

Metafiles, bitmaps, or OLE objects that have been rotated will not be rotated in Visio 5.0.
Geometry and text blocks that have been added to metafiles, bitmaps, and OLE objects will be removed.
Line-jump styles will default to the Visio 5.0 arc style.
Character spacing and strikethrough/double-underlined type formatting are removed.
Outward connection points are converted to inward connection points and connection point angles are removed. 

NOTE Visio 2000 products support drawings of far greater complexity than was possible in Visio 5.0 products. Attempting to save Visio 2000 drawings that have a number of objects exceeding the limitations of Visio 5.0 products may not succeed.


CAD CONVERSION TECHNOLOGY IN VISIO 2000, STANDARD EDITION

Autodesk AutoCAD drawing (.dwg) and Bentley MicroStation Drawing (.dgn) formats appear as available options when you save a Visio 2000 file. Although these file types are listed, the Visio 2000, Standard Edition, program does not include full CAD-conversion capabilities. For information about CAD-conversion functionality in Visio 2000 products, please see the Visio product comparison Web page (www.visio.com/products).


SUPPORT FOR MICROSOFT OFFICE LANGUAGE DICTIONARIES

Visio 2000, Standard Edition, can use language dictionaries provided with Microsoft Word 95, Word 97 and Word 2000. Visio 2000 will use these dictionaries by default if they are installed on the system.

Visio 2000 is not licensed to use all of the language dictionaries provided with Microsoft Word 2000. Currently, the US English release of Visio 2000, Standard Edition, is licensed to use only the English dictionaries. If Visio detects a Word 2000 language dictionary for its default language (e.g., German for German Visio) that it is not licensed to use, it will not use any Word 2000 dictionaries.


INSTALLING THE VISIO BUTTON ON THE MICROSOFT WORD, EXCEL, OR POWERPOINT TOOLBAR

You can install the Visio button on the toolbars of versions of Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint manually by running the Insert Visio Buttons.exe file in the VisioSystemCustom folder. 

The Insert Visio Buttons.exe file will attempt to install the Visio button on the toolbars of the following Microsoft Office applications:

Microsoft Word 95, Word 97, and Word 2000
Microsoft Excel 95, Excel 97, and Excel 2000
Microsoft PowerPoint 2000

The Visio toolbar button provides a one-click method by which to embed a Visio drawing into these applications. The same action can be completed by using an application's Insert > Object command.

NOTE If the VisioSystemCustom folder is not present in your installation of Visio 2000, run the Add/Remove Programs utility in the Windows Control Panel, choose Visio 2000, and click the Add/Remove button. In the Visio Installation Manager, select the Add/Remove option, and then click the Microsoft Office Integration option in the list of features.


VISIO DOCUMENTATION IN ACROBAT READER FORMAT

The Visio 2000, Standard Edition, CD includes online versions of the Visio 2000 printed documentation set. You must have the Adobe Acrobat Reader version 3.0 or later installed on your PC before you can view the online documentation. If you have not already acquired and installed a copy of Acrobat Reader on your PC, you can install version 4.0 from your Visio 2000, Standard Edition, CD. 

To install Adobe Acrobat Reader 4.0, double-click the file AR40ENG.EXE in the Acrobat folder of your Visio 2000, Standard Edition, CD and follow the instructions on your screen. For more information on Adobe Acrobat Reader, visit the Adobe Web site (www.adobe.com).


SUPPORT FOR THE MICROSOFT INTELLIMOUSE

Visio 2000 provides support for the Microsoft IntelliMouse. The following wheel actions are supported in a Visio drawing window:

Roll = vertical scroll
Shift + roll = horizontal scroll
Ctrl + roll = zoom
Click + drag = pan

Some of these actions are also supported in other Visio windows (such as Stencil, ShapeSheet, and Print Preview) where appropriate.


INSTALLING ON HEBREW AND ARABIC SYSTEMS

The Visio Installation Manager may fail on Hebrew and Arabic language versions of Microsoft Windows. If you have trouble installing Visio 2000 on a Hebrew or Arabic language version of Windows:

1.	On the Visio 2000 CD, find the file Comctl32.exe in the following location:  Installbinwindowssystem32Comctl32.exe.
2.	Double-click Comctl32.exe. Comctl32.exe will update the Comctl32.dll, which is in the WindowsSystem32 folder.
3.	Run Setup.exe, located at the root of the Visio 2000 CD.


OPEN DOCUMENT MANAGEMENT API (ODMA) SUPPORT

Testing of ODMA support in Visio 2000, Standard Edition, was limited to DOCS Open version 3.7.2 from PC DOCS, Inc. Other ODMA-compliant applications may function as expected with Visio 2000, but certification testing was not performed.


COM ADD-INS SUPPORT NOT IMPLEMENTED

Support for the loading of COM Add-ins when Visio 2000 is loaded (under Tools > Options, Advanced tab) has not been implemented in this release of Visio 2000, Standard Edition.


CRASH OR SYSTEM HANG WHEN WORKING WITH LARGE DRAWINGS ON MICROSOFT WINDOWS 98 USING ADOBE POSTSCRIPT PRINTER DRIVER VERSION 4.1

When Visio 2000 is adding a large number of shapes with text to a drawing, a system crash or hang can occur. This will happen only on Windows 98 systems using the original Adobe PostScript printer driver, version 4.1. This problem may appear as a memory leak, which causes all other applications and menus to stop operating. A typical symptom may be an error in GDI.exe.

The problem can be prevented by installing the newest Adobe PostScript printer driver, version 4.3.1, for Windows 98 available at: http://www.adobe.com/support/downloads/pdrvwin.htm.


TEXT IS SPACED INCORRECTLY WHEN PRINTED TO LEXMARK OPTRACOLOR PRINTERS

Lexmark Optracolor, as well as some other printers that allow substitution of the printer fonts for the TrueType fonts, may print text that is incorrectly spaced. This problem can be fixed by changing the printer driver setting from "Font Substitution" to "Download Soft Fonts." In some cases, you may need to load an updated printer driver from Lexmark.


SYSTEM HANG WITH VISIO 2000 ON MICROSOFT WINDOWS NT4.0 TERMINAL SERVER

When installing Visio 2000 on a Microsoft Windows NT4.0 Terminal Server from a client, the installation process is extremely slow. A typical symptom may be that each component takes minutes to install rather than seconds. Another symptom may be that the installation wizard appears to hang. These delays can be fixed by performing the installation on the server machine.

Follow these steps to install:
1. Log onto the server as user with Administrator privileges.

	2. Go to Start > Settings > Control Panel.

	3. Double-click Add/Remove Programs.

	4. On the Install/Uninstall tab, click Install.

	5. Browse to the installation source directory for Microsoft Visio 2000.

	6. Begin the installation process, and follow the instructions on your screen.

Additionally, there may be an issue running Visio 2000 with Feature Management turned on. A typical symptom may be that the system appears to hang when trying to launch the Visio application. You can fix this problem by opening the registry and running regedit.exe. Then place the following key and value in the registry:

	Key: HKLMSoftwareMicrosoftWindows NTCurrentVersionTerminal ServerInstallSoftwareVisioVisio 2000ApplicationFeaturemgmt

	String Value: 0



Microsoft Visio 2000, Standard Edition
END of Release Notes
